label: Figma API
description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the figma API.

tools.name: AddCommentToFigmaFile
tools.description:
Posts a new comment on a Figma file.

    Use this tool to post a new comment on a specified file in Figma, identified by file_key.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: figma_file_key
parameters.description: File or branch key for the Figma file where the comment will be added. Retrieve this using `GET /v1/files/:key` with the `branch_data` query param for branch keys.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: AddFigmaCommentReaction
tools.description:
Add a reaction to a comment on a Figma file.

    Use this tool to post a new reaction to an existing comment on a Figma file. It should be called when you want to react to a specific comment in a Figma project.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: file_or_branch_key
parameters.description: Key of the file or branch where the comment reaction should be posted. Can be obtained via the Figma API.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: comment_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the comment you want to react to in a Figma file.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: BulkUpdateFigmaDevResources
tools.description:
Update multiple Figma dev resources in bulk.

This tool updates developer resources across multiple Figma files. It should be called when you need to apply changes to several resources at once. The response will include arrays indicating which resources were successfully updated and which encountered errors.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CreateBulkDevResources
tools.description:
Bulk create developer resources in multiple Figma files.

Use this tool to create multiple developer resources across different Figma files. Successfully created resources will be listed in the response, while any errors will also be provided, indicating issues such as non-existent file keys or duplicate URLs.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CreateFigmaWebhook
tools.description:
Create a new webhook for Figma events.

This tool creates a webhook in Figma that triggers an event to a specified endpoint. It sends a PING event by default, unless set to PAUSED, and can be reactivated later.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteDevResource
tools.description:
Delete a dev resource from a Figma file.

Call this tool to delete a specific developer resource from a Figma file using the file key and resource ID.

parameters.name: target_file_key
parameters.description: The main file key from which to delete the dev resource. Must not be a branch key.

parameters.name: dev_resource_id
parameters.description: The ID of the developer resource to delete from the Figma file.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteFigmaComment
tools.description:
Delete your comment from a Figma file.

Use this tool to delete a specific comment you made on a Figma file. Only the original commenter can delete their comments.

parameters.name: figma_file_key
parameters.description: The file or branch key from which to delete the comment. Use `GET /v1/files/:key` with `branch_data` to obtain the branch key.

parameters.name: comment_identifier
parameters.description: The ID of the comment you wish to delete from the Figma file. Only the original commenter can perform this action.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteFigmaWebhook
tools.description:
Delete a specified webhook in Figma.

Use this tool to delete a specified webhook in Figma. This action is irreversible and should be called when a webhook is no longer needed.

parameters.name: webhook_id_to_delete
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the webhook you wish to delete. This ID is required for the deletion operation.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DeleteMyCommentReaction
tools.description:
Deletes your specific comment reaction in Figma.

This tool allows users to delete a reaction they added to a comment in a Figma file. It can only be used if the reaction was made by the person attempting to delete it.

parameters.name: reaction_emoji
parameters.description: The emoji associated with the reaction to be deleted. Only the emoji used for the reaction you added can be deleted.

parameters.name: file_or_branch_key
parameters.description: Key of the Figma file or branch where the reaction should be deleted. Use `GET /v1/files/:key` with the `branch_data` query param to obtain the branch key if needed.

parameters.name: comment_id
parameters.description: The ID of the comment from which you want to delete your reaction.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: FetchCommentReactions
tools.description:
Retrieve reactions from a specific comment in Figma.

Use this tool to obtain a list of reactions left on a specific comment in a Figma file. This can help track engagement or feedback on comments.

parameters.name: file_or_branch_key
parameters.description: The key for the file or branch to retrieve the comment reactions from in Figma.

parameters.name: comment_id
parameters.description: ID of the comment from which to retrieve reactions.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for pagination. Use the cursor from the previous call's response to retrieve the next set of reactions.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: FetchComponentUsageData
tools.description:
Fetch library analytics component usage data by dimension.

This tool retrieves a list of library analytics component usage data, providing insights into how components are used, broken down by the specified dimension.

parameters.name: group_by_dimension
parameters.description: A dimension to group the returned analytics data. Choose between 'component' or 'file'.

parameters.name: library_file_key
parameters.description: The file key of the library to fetch analytics data for. Required for specifying the target library.

parameters.name: data_page_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor indicating which page of data to fetch, obtained from a prior API call.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: FetchFigmaFile
tools.description:
Retrieve a Figma file as a JSON object using its file key.

Use this tool to fetch a Figma document as JSON, identified by a file key. The returned data includes the document structure and metadata about components.

parameters.name: file_key
parameters.description: The unique key of the Figma file or branch to retrieve as JSON.

parameters.name: version_id
parameters.description: Specify the version ID to retrieve a specific version of the file. Default is the current version.

parameters.name: node_ids_of_interest
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of node IDs to retrieve specific parts of the Figma document.

parameters.name: traversal_depth
parameters.description: Positive integer indicating the depth in the document tree to retrieve. For example, 1 returns only Pages; 2 returns Pages and top-level objects.

parameters.name: export_vector_data
parameters.description: Set to "paths" to include vector data in the response.

parameters.name: include_plugin_data
parameters.description: Comma separated list of plugin IDs and/or 'shared'. Includes plugin data in the result.

parameters.name: include_branch_metadata
parameters.description: Set to true to include metadata about branches related to the file. If false, branch information will not be returned.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: FetchFileVersionHistory
tools.description:
Fetch the version history of a Figma file.

Use this tool to obtain the version history of a specific Figma file, enabling the analysis of its changes over time. This can be useful for reviewing past edits or rendering specific versions.

parameters.name: target_file_key
parameters.description: The key of the file or branch to fetch version history for. Use this to specify the Figma file whose version history you need.

parameters.name: number_of_items_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the number of items to return per page. Defaults to 30 if not provided.

parameters.name: get_versions_before_id
parameters.description: A version ID to get versions before it in the history. Used for pagination.

parameters.name: after_version_id
parameters.description: Version ID to fetch subsequent versions. Used for pagination. Omit if not paginating.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: FetchImageFillLinks
tools.description:
Retrieve download links for images in a Figma document.

Use this tool to get download links for all images present in the image fills of a Figma document. These links allow access to images users have added to their design files. The URLs will expire after about 14 days and can be found using image references.

parameters.name: file_or_branch_key
parameters.description: The file or branch key from which to retrieve image URLs. Use `GET /v1/files/:key` to get the branch key if needed.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: FetchLibraryAnalyticsVariableActions
tools.description:
Retrieve library analytics variable actions data from Figma.

Call this tool to obtain a breakdown of library analytics variable actions data from Figma based on a specific dimension.

parameters.name: group_by_dimension
parameters.description: A dimension to group the returned analytics data by. Options: 'variable', 'team'.

parameters.name: library_file_key
parameters.description: The file key of the library for which to fetch analytics data.

parameters.name: page_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor to indicate which page of data to fetch, obtained from a previous API call.

parameters.name: earliest_week_start_date
parameters.description: ISO 8601 date string (YYYY-MM-DD) representing the earliest week to include. Rounded back to the nearest week's start. Defaults to one year prior.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: ISO 8601 date string (YYYY-MM-DD) for the latest week to include. Defaults to the latest computed week.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: FigmaGetTeamProjects
tools.description:
Fetch all projects within a specified Figma team.

This tool retrieves a list of projects for a specified team in Figma, visible to the authenticated user.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the Figma team to list projects from. This is required to specify which team's projects to retrieve.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetDevResources
tools.description:
Retrieve development resources from a Figma file.

Use this tool to gather development resources from a specific Figma file using the file key.

parameters.name: file_key
parameters.description: The main file key for fetching development resources from a Figma file. Ensure it is not a branch key.

parameters.name: target_node_ids
parameters.description: Comma separated list of node IDs to filter dev resources. If left blank, returns resources for all nodes.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetFigmaComponentMetadata
tools.description:
Retrieve metadata for a Figma component by key.

Use this tool to obtain detailed metadata about a specific Figma component using its key.

parameters.name: component_key
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Figma component to retrieve metadata for.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetFigmaComponentSet
tools.description:
Retrieve metadata for a Figma component set using its key.

Use this tool to obtain detailed metadata about a published component set in Figma by providing its unique key identifier.

parameters.name: component_set_key
parameters.description: The unique key identifier for the Figma component set to retrieve metadata.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetFigmaFileComments
tools.description:
Retrieve comments from a Figma file.

Use this tool to get a list of comments left on a specific Figma file. It is useful for accessing feedback or discussions related to file elements.

parameters.name: figma_file_or_branch_key
parameters.description: Specify the file or branch key to retrieve comments from. Use the `GET /v1/files/:key` endpoint with `branch_data` query param for branch keys.

parameters.name: return_comments_as_markdown
parameters.description: Set to true to return comments as markdown equivalents when applicable.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetFigmaFileComponents
tools.description:
Retrieve published components from a Figma file library.

Use this tool to obtain a list of all published components within a specific Figma file, allowing for design asset management or analysis.

parameters.name: file_key
parameters.description: Main file key to list components from. Must not be a branch key.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetFigmaFileNodes
tools.description:
Retrieve nodes and metadata from a Figma file.

Use this tool to get detailed information about specific nodes in a Figma file, including metadata like name, last modified date, thumbnail URL, editor type, version, and link access permissions. Also retrieves document structure, component mappings, and styles. Useful for accessing and analyzing Figma design elements.

parameters.name: node_ids_to_retrieve
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of Figma node IDs to retrieve as JSON.

parameters.name: figma_file_key
parameters.description: The file or branch key from which to export JSON data in Figma.

parameters.name: specific_version_id
parameters.description: Specify a version ID to retrieve a particular version of the Figma file. If omitted, the current version is retrieved.

parameters.name: node_tree_depth
parameters.description: Positive integer indicating how deep into the node tree to traverse from the starting node. A value of 1 returns only immediate children. Leaving it unset returns all nodes.

parameters.name: export_vector_data
parameters.description: Set to "paths" to include vector data in the response.

parameters.name: include_plugin_data
parameters.description: Comma-separated plugin IDs and/or 'shared' to include plugin-related data in results.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetFigmaProjectFiles
tools.description:
Retrieve all files from a specific Figma project.

This tool fetches a list of all files within the specified Figma project. Use it when you need to access or manage project files stored in Figma.

parameters.name: project_identifier
parameters.description: The unique string ID of the Figma project from which to list files.

parameters.name: include_branch_metadata
parameters.description: Include branch metadata for each main file with a branch in the project. Set to true to receive this data, otherwise false.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetFigmaWebhook
tools.description:
Retrieve a Figma webhook by its ID.

Use this tool to obtain detailed information about a specific Figma webhook by providing its unique ID.

parameters.name: webhook_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the Figma webhook to retrieve.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetFigmaWebhooks
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of webhooks from Figma.

Call this tool to get a list of webhooks available in your Figma context or plan. This can be used to manage and view all the webhooks you have access to, with results provided in a paginated format.

parameters.name: webhook_context
parameters.description: Specify the context for the webhooks. Accepts 'team', 'project', or 'file'.

parameters.name: context_identifier
parameters.description: The ID of the context to fetch attached webhooks. Cannot be used with plan_api_id.

parameters.name: plan_id_for_webhooks
parameters.description: The ID of your plan for retrieving webhooks across all accessible contexts. Cannot be used with context or context_id.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for pagination when using plan_api_id. Provide next_page or prev_page from previous response to navigate pages.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetFileMetadata
tools.description:
Retrieve metadata for a specified Figma file.

This tool is used to obtain metadata information from a specific Figma file by providing the file key. It can be called when users need to access details about a Figma file, such as its name, creator, and other properties.

parameters.name: file_identifier
parameters.description: File or branch key to get metadata for. Use the `branch_data` query param to get the branch key.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetLibraryAnalyticsComponentActions
tools.description:
Get analytics for library component actions.

Retrieve detailed data on library component actions in Figma, broken down by the specified dimension. This tool is used to gain insights into how components in a Figma library are being utilized.

parameters.name: group_by_dimension
parameters.description: Specify the dimension to group the analytics data by. Options are 'component' or 'team'.

parameters.name: library_file_key
parameters.description: The unique file key for the Figma library to retrieve analytics data from.

parameters.name: data_page_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor indicating the specific page of data to fetch, obtained from a previous API call.

parameters.name: earliest_start_date
parameters.description: ISO 8601 date string (YYYY-MM-DD) for the earliest week to include. Rounded back to the start of a week. Defaults to one year prior.

parameters.name: latest_inclusion_date
parameters.description: ISO 8601 date string (YYYY-MM-DD) of the latest week to include, rounded forward to the nearest week's end. Defaults to the latest computed week.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetLibraryAnalyticsVariableUsages
tools.description:
Retrieve analytics on library variable usage.

Fetches a breakdown of library analytics variable usage data by the specified dimension.

parameters.name: group_by_dimension
parameters.description: Specifies the dimension ('variable' or 'file') for grouping library analytics data.

parameters.name: library_file_key
parameters.description: The unique key of the library to fetch analytics data from.

parameters.name: page_cursor
parameters.description: A token to fetch the specific page of results, received from a previous API call.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetLibraryStyleActions
tools.description:
Retrieve library style analytics actions data by dimension.

Use this tool to obtain detailed actions data for styles in a Figma library, categorized by the specified dimension. Ideal for analyzing how styles are used or modified.

parameters.name: group_by_dimension
parameters.description: Specify the dimension ('style' or 'team') to group the returned analytics data by.

parameters.name: library_file_key
parameters.description: The unique file key of the Figma library to retrieve analytics data for.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: A cursor to indicate which page of data to fetch. Obtain this from a prior API call.

parameters.name: earliest_week_start_date
parameters.description: ISO 8601 date string (YYYY-MM-DD) for the earliest week to include. Dates round back to the nearest week start. Defaults to one year prior.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: ISO 8601 date string (YYYY-MM-DD) for the latest week to include, rounded to the week's end. Defaults to the latest computed week if not specified.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetLibraryStyleUsageData
tools.description:
Retrieve style usage data from Figma library analytics.

This tool returns library analytics style usage data from Figma, broken down by the requested dimension. It should be used to analyze style usage within a specific Figma library file.

parameters.name: group_by_dimension
parameters.description: Dimension to group the returned analytics data by. Options are 'style' or 'file'.

parameters.name: library_file_key
parameters.description: The file key of the Figma library to fetch analytics data for. This is required to specify the source library.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor indicating which page of data to fetch, obtained from a previous API call.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetPublishedComponentSets
tools.description:
Retrieve published component sets from a Figma file.

Call this tool to get a list of published component sets within a specified Figma file library. Useful for accessing design components efficiently.

parameters.name: main_file_key
parameters.description: The main file key of the Figma file to list component sets from. Must not be a branch key.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetPublishedStylesFromFile
tools.description:
Retrieve published styles from a Figma file library.

Use this tool to get a list of published styles within a specific Figma file library. Useful when you need to analyze or display the styles used in a Figma file.

parameters.name: main_file_key
parameters.description: Main file key to list styles from. Must not be a branch key.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetPublishedVariables
tools.description:
Retrieve published variables from a Figma file.

Call this tool to get a list of variables that are published from a specified Figma file. The response includes variable and collection details along with `subscribed_id`. Ideal for users needing information on published variables from a file within an Enterprise organization.

parameters.name: main_file_key
parameters.description: The key of the Figma file to retrieve published variables from. Only use the main file key, not a branch key.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetRecentWebhookRequests
tools.description:
Retrieve recent webhook requests from the last week.

Use this tool to gather webhook requests sent within the last week for debugging purposes.

parameters.name: webhook_subscription_id
parameters.description: The ID of the webhook subscription for which to retrieve recent events.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetStyleMetadata
tools.description:
Retrieve Figma style metadata by key.

Use this tool to get detailed metadata about a specific style in Figma using its unique key. Useful for accessing style information for design analysis or integration.

parameters.name: style_key
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Figma style to retrieve metadata for.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetTeamComponents
tools.description:
Retrieve published components from a team's Figma library.

Use this tool to get a list of components that have been published within a specified team's library in Figma.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the team whose components you want to retrieve. This ID is necessary to specify the source team library in Figma.

parameters.name: number_of_items_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the number of components to return in one page. Defaults to 30, maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: cursor_after_id
parameters.description: Cursor indicating which ID to start retrieving components after. Cannot be used with 'before'.

parameters.name: cursor_before
parameters.description: Cursor to retrieve components starting before a specific id. Exclusive with 'cursor_after'.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetTeamComponentSets
tools.description:
Fetch published component sets from a Figma team library.

This tool retrieves a paginated list of component sets that have been published within a specified team library in Figma. It should be used when you need to access or explore available component sets in a particular Figma team.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the team from which to list component sets.

parameters.name: number_of_items_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the number of items to return per page in the results. Defaults to 30.

parameters.name: start_after_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor indicating the starting point for retrieving component sets, exclusive with `end_before_cursor`. This cursor is an internally tracked integer not corresponding to any IDs.

parameters.name: cursor_before_id
parameters.description: Cursor ID indicating the point before which to retrieve component sets. It must be exclusive with the 'after' cursor.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetTeamStyles
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of published styles from a team's library in Figma.

This tool retrieves a paginated list of styles that have been published within a specified team's library in Figma. It should be called when you need access to design styles, such as colors or text styles, that a team has made available in their library.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the team from which to retrieve published styles.

parameters.name: items_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the number of styles to return per page. Defaults to 30 if not provided.

parameters.name: start_after_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor to start retrieving styles after a specific ID. Cannot be used with before. Internally tracked integer.

parameters.name: cursor_before_id
parameters.description: Cursor for retrieving styles before a specific ID. Use this to paginate backwards. Exclusive with after.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetUserInformation
tools.description:
Retrieve information for the authenticated Figma user.

Use this tool to obtain the profile information of the user currently authenticated in the Figma service.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ManageFigmaVariables
tools.description:
Manage and organize Figma variable collections in bulk.

    This tool allows you to create, update, and delete variable collections, modes, and variables within Figma files for Enterprise members with Editor seats. Use it to handle variable operations in bulk, including setting mode values and managing temporary IDs. Ideal for organizing complex Figma projects efficiently.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: file_identifier
parameters.description: Specifies the Figma file or branch key to modify variables. Retrieve branch key using `GET /v1/files/:key` with `branch_data` parameter.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: RenderFigmaImages
tools.description:
Fetch rendered images from Figma files by node IDs.

Use this tool to render and retrieve images from a Figma file by specifying node IDs. The tool returns a mapping of node IDs to URLs of the rendered images. Note: Some entries may be null if rendering fails for certain nodes. Images expire after 30 days.

parameters.name: node_ids_to_render
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of node IDs for images to be rendered.

parameters.name: figma_file_key
parameters.description: The key for the Figma file or branch to export images from. Use with the `branch_data` query parameter to obtain branch key if needed.

parameters.name: version_id
parameters.description: Specify a version ID to retrieve a particular version of a Figma file. If omitted, will use the current version.

parameters.name: image_scale_factor
parameters.description: A number between 0.01 and 4, representing the image scaling factor for rendering.

parameters.name: image_output_format
parameters.description: Specify the image format for the output. Options are 'jpg', 'png', 'svg', or 'pdf'.

parameters.name: render_text_as_outlines
parameters.description: Determines if text elements are rendered as outlines in SVGs. Set `true` for visual consistency; `false` for selectable text.

parameters.name: include_svg_id_attributes
parameters.description: Include id attributes for all SVG elements. Adds the layer name to the 'id' attribute.

parameters.name: include_node_id_in_svg_elements
parameters.description: Set to true to include node ID attributes for all SVG elements, adding the node ID to a `data-node-id` attribute.

parameters.name: svg_stroke_simplification_enabled
parameters.description: Set to true to simplify inside/outside strokes in SVG using stroke attributes instead of `<mask>`.

parameters.name: exclude_overlapping_content
parameters.description: Set to true to exclude overlapping content from rendering. Set to false to include overlaps, which may increase processing time.

parameters.name: use_full_dimensions_without_cropping
parameters.description: Export using full node dimensions, ignoring cropping and empty space. Ensures text nodes are fully visible.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: RetrieveFigmaLocalVariables
tools.description:
Retrieve local and remote variables from a Figma file.

Use this tool to get a list of local variables created in a Figma file and any remote variables utilized, identified by their `subscribed_id`. This tool is available to full members of Enterprise organizations. It's useful for examining mode values and understanding variable usage within a file.

parameters.name: file_or_branch_key
parameters.description: The key for the file or branch to retrieve variables from in Figma. If a branch, use `GET /v1/files/:key` with the `branch_data` query param to get the branch key.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: UpdateFigmaWebhook
tools.description:
Update a Figma webhook by its ID.

    Use this tool to update the settings or parameters of an existing webhook in Figma by specifying the webhook ID.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: webhook_id_to_update
parameters.description: Provide the ID of the Figma webhook you want to update.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

summary:
Arcade Toolkit for Figma API empowers LLMs to seamlessly interact with Figma projects. This toolkit provides a robust set of capabilities for managing design assets, comments, and webhooks within Figma.  

**Capabilities**  
- Manage comments, including adding, deleting, and reacting to them.  
- Create, update, and delete developer resources in bulk across multiple Figma files.  
- Access and manipulate Figma components, styles, and variables for efficient asset management.  
- Fetch analytics data and version histories to analyze design changes and usage trends.  
- Integrate webhooks for real-time updates on design changes and events.  

**OAuth**  
- Provider: Figma  
- Scopes: current_user:read, file_comments:read, file_comments:write, file_content:read, file_dev_resources:read, file_dev_resources:write, file_metadata:read, file_variables:read, file_variables:write, file_versions:read, library_analytics:read, library_assets:read, library_content:read, projects:read, team_library_content:read, webhooks:read, webhooks:write
